description: The tunnel branches off to the south.
5004.name: {BThe Underground {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x

description: A vast desert stretches for miles, the sand constantly shifting around you.
You feel lost.
5028.name: Sands of Sorrow

description: Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
You have stumbled upon the home of something. From the treasure
haphazardly strewn about and the rotting carcasses, you would guess that
this is a dragon's lair. As to what type, you can't really say. The cave
narrows out into a tunnel to the west.
5065.name: Mysterious lair

description: This cavern overwhelms you. The walls and ceiling seem miles away.
Bones of previous adventurers lie strewn on the cavern floor.
5011.name: Giant cave

description: The walls here are extremely damp, as well as the floor.
5014.name: Damp hallway

description: You hear drops of water.
You are wading in a knee deep pool of lime-water.
5015.name: Underground pool

description: This tent is as lavishly decorated on the inside as it is on the
outside. A fancy carpet lies on the sand and numerous baskets line the
walls.
5060.name: Main tent

description: You see some peaceful camels.
A vast desert stretches for miles, the sand constantly shifting around you.
You feel lost.
5026.name: Sands of Sorrow

description: Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
This part of the tunnel is the hardest to move through as the walls
move in to meet you.
5068.name: Narrow crack

description: You are standing in a large cave. Many furs are spread out on the floor.
5013.name: Large cave

description: This small group of desert nomads has stopped for the day to rest
and refresh themselves beside this beautiful oasis. Three tents and some
camels make up the party. From within two of the tents you hear muffled
voices, obviously surprised at your visit.
5056.name: Nomad camp

description: You see ill-tempered camels.
You see inside one of the tents a huddled mass of people, probably slaves.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
A vast desert stretches for miles, the sand constantly shifting around you.
You feel lost.
5029.name: Sands of Sorrow

description: Sand as far as the eye can see.
The sand is glowing in this direction.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
A vast desert stretches for miles, the sand constantly shifting around you.
You feel lost.
5024.name: Sands of Sorrow

description: Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
You enter the tent to see a number of counters, each bearing a
package or three.  Also present is a large counter, with a sign hung
above it reading, "Outbound."
5036.name: SOS Courier

description: You are floating on a jet-black underground lake fed by dripping
water and lime from above. The tunnel continues to the east and the river
leads back west. To the north is a roughly-hewn hallway. There is also
a tunnel south.
5005.name: {BThe Underground {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x

description: You stand in the middle of a large and beautiful cave. A path leads
deeper into the darkness.
5010.name: Cave entrance

description: You look down into the cave. Bones are strewn about everywhere.
You have entered a very large cavern. The rock formations would amaze
almost any dwarf.
5018.name: Large cavern

description: As you walk along the path, millions of spores are shot at you. You can
hardly breathe.
5020.name: Fungus path

description: The fragrant smell of spores continues to the west.
A giant mushroom temple stands to the south.
This is a small and simple tent with few possessions in sight. Lying
here and there are young-looking men and women, possibly slaves to the
leader of this band.
5057.name: Inside a small tent

description: Waving in the heat over the sand you see a HUGE pyramid.
You see the center of the nomad camp.
A vast desert stretches for miles, the sand constantly shifting around you.
You feel lost.
5031.name: Sands of Sorrow

description: Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
A vast desert stretches for miles, the sand constantly shifting around you.
You feel lost.
5033.name: Sands of Sorrow

description: A vast desert stretches for miles, the sand constantly shifting around you.
You feel lost.
5030.name: Sands of Sorrow

description: Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
You stand at the edge of a large pile of rubble created from the last
rockslide.
5008.name: Cave-in

description: You can easily slide down the rocks without getting hurt.
The tunnel becomes very narrow and you fight to squeeze your way through.
The floor seems to level off a little.
5067.name: Narrower tunnel

description: The tunnel continues east and west. To the east the tunnel dives
down into a bright light. A dark tunnel goes south.
5007.name: Wide tunnel

description: You are floating on a jet-black underground lake fed by dripping
water and lime from above.  The tunnel continues to the east and the
river leads back west.  To the north is a roughly-hewn hallway.  There
is also a tunnel south.
5006.name: Underground Lake

description: The walls of the tunnel are extremely damp here. You hear the faint
sound of running water to the south.
5016.name: Damp hallway

description: You hear drops of water.
The air in here is MUCH cooler than outside. From the west you hear
strange sounds, but can see nothing. The cave slopes down into the
darkness.
5064.name: Cave mouth

description: Outside is lighter and very windy.
The tunnel turns to the south and west.
5012.name: Narrow bend

description: A vast desert stretches for miles, the sand constantly shifting around you.
You feel lost.
5032.name: Sands of Sorrow

description: Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
You see a tiny ledge.
You follow a path sloping down from the fungus temple.
5022.name: Sloping passage

description: This tent has a few furnishings, but mainly it holds the band's
protectors. They all stare at you coldly as you enter.
5059.name: Warrior's tent

description: Outside you see some peaceful camels.
From within this shaft you can see a narrow hole in the roof just
large enough for one person. Back south is the cavern.
5070.name: Small shaft

description: You are within the SOS Courier checkpoint.  To the east is the
Nomad Commander's tent, and to the north is a parking lot for your
airship.
5034.name: SOS Courier

description: A vast desert stretches for miles, the sand constantly shifting around you.
You feel lost.
5027.name: Sands of Sorrow

description: Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
This is where the leader of this band of nomads resides. He is
definitely rich as you inspect the tapestries, baskets, and a few
paintings as well.
5061.name: Main tent

description: You see the entrance to this tent.
A vast desert stretches for miles, the sand constantly shifting around
you.  But this patch of desert looks different...the sand glows.  You see a
futuristic city to the south.
5062.name: Strange Glowing Sand

description: Sand as far as the eye can see.
The sand here is covered over with asphalt, under a huge canopy to
shield it from the desert sun.  The tarmac, while specifically for
airships, also holds a series of tents, with a single huge one bearing
a sign reading, "{YSOS Courier{x"
5035.name: Airship Parking

description: You find yourself standing inside of a giant mushroom. The inside
is decorated in the fashion of a temple.
5021.name: Fungus temple

description: The tunnel branches off south.
5003.name: {BThe Underground {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x

description: As you walk through the fungus patch, you are shot at by many millions of
spores. You can hardly breathe.
5019.name: Fungus patch

description: The fragrant smell of fungus spores continues to the east
It is dark and damp and bats hang from the ceiling. A narrow crack is
in the east wall. The floor now slopes upwards.
5069.name: Small cavern

description: You encounter some rapids as you enter this tunnel cut out of
the mountains by the river.
5001.name: {BThe Underground {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x

description: This tunnel seems to go on forever into the darkness. You carefully
feel your way along the walls.
5066.name: Wide tunnel

description: This crawlway is just big enough for a human to crawl through or a
halfling to walk through.
5017.name: Narrow crawlway

description: You smell the fragrant odor of fungus.
You are at the bottom of a large pile of rubble. A tunnel branches
off to the north and east.
5009.name: At the foot of the rubble

description: A vast desert stretches for miles, the sand constantly shifting around you.
You feel lost.
5025.name: Sands of Sorrow

description: You see a nomad camp by an oasis.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
Sand as far as the eye can see.
The tunnel branches off north.
5002.name: {BThe Underground {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x

description: You are on a path that gently slopes up from the underground pool.
5023.name: Sloping passage

description: You hear sounds of trickling water.
Here stand about ten camels, all hitched to some stakes plugged into
the ground. To the east you see a small tent while to the north you see a
larger, fancier tent.
5058.name: Beside the camels

description: This tent seems to be the temporary abode of the nomad leader. You make a
mental note to visit it before you leave.
In this tent there are very large men, all carrying weapons.
You see the center of the nomad camp.
Being very careful not to lose your balance, you look around and
find that this canyon is about a half a kilometer deep. To the west is
a dark cave leading under the desert sands.
5063.name: Wind-swept ledge

description: Sand as far as the eye can see.
You see a dark cave.

Dressed in loose fitting rags, this man looks like he could use
some rest.
5000.room_name: The raggity dervish walks on aimlessly.
5000.name: The dervish~

description:
Dressed in loose fitting rags, this man looks like he could use
LOTS of rest.
5001.room_name: The large dervish watches for signs of trouble.
5001.name: The dervish~

description:
This relatively harmless snake has bright alternating bands of red, yellow
and black.
5002.name: a {Rc{Yo{Rr{Ya{Rl {gsnake{x~

description: The little tail is mighty dangerous for such a small creature.
5003.room_name: A small, red scorpion scuttles away at your approach.
5003.name: The small scorpion~

description: He's big, mean, and purple. Watch out!
5004.room_name: A giant, purple sand worm thrusts up out of the sand and attacks!
5004.name: The giant, purple sand worm~

description:
Named for their light copper coloring, brass dragons are notorious
hoarders of wealth.  This dragon in particular seems plump and lazy,
suggesting it might be sitting on quite a bit of treasure.
5005.room_name: A {Ybr{ya{Yss {gdragon {xrises up out of the darkness.
5005.name: a {Ybr{ya{Yss {gdragon{x~

description:
He is clad in silk robes lined with gold thread. At his side
is a large, engraved cutlass. He has an especially haughty air
about him.
5006.room_name: The nomad leader sits silently in prayer.
5006.name: The nomad leader~

description:
This is the nomad leader's second in command. His clothes are richly
woven of silk and gold thread. A nasty cutlass hangs at his side.
5007.room_name: The nomad commander stands here staring suspiciously at you.
5007.name: The nomad commander~

5008.room_name: A proud nomad warrior stands here.
5008.name: The nomad warrior~

5009.room_name: A young slave sits here staring at you with pleading eyes.
5009.name: The slave~

description:
The dracolich is now only bone with pieces of flesh hanging from it.
Obviously it no longer fears death.
5010.room_name: A pile of bones rises up to form a skeletal dracolich.
5010.name: The dracolich~

description: This half-spider, half-drow creature is a formidable opponent.
5011.room_name: The drider looks at you viciously while it draws its sword.
5011.name: The drider~

description: The duergar could crush your head as easily as it does those rocks.
5012.room_name: A duergar is here mining precious stones with his pick.
5012.name: The dark dwarf~

description:
The myconoid looks something like a giant mushroom (and probably
has the same effect).
5013.name: the myconoid~

description: The shaman shoots spores into the air.
5014.room_name: A rather large myconoid stands here chanting in a strange tongue.
5014.name: The myconoid shaman~

5015.room_name: A small oasis invites you to dive in.
5015.name: The dustdigger~

5016.room_name: A SOS Courier shift foreman stands behind the counter, toying with a package.
5016.name: a courier foreman~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description: Don't mess with this animal.
5017.room_name: A very dangerous rabid camel snorts at you.
5017.name: The rabid camel~
